![XDaCUTP.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/XDaCUTP.jpg)

*The Stanley Parable is the name of two subjects; one is a Half-life 2 map created in 2012. It mocked the trope in gaming of the narrator dictating every action of the player's movement by having the Narrator say something, and having the choice to either follow it, or not. The second subject is the HD remake that got Greenlit on Steam in 2013. This version was very* *similar to the mod, except a lot was still different.*

Sorry, the Narrator was holding his grasp on me. So basically, this is a discussion thread about this awesome game worth all $15 the HD remake costs with many weird endings, and many choices. (The way I was introduced was by the Danny2462 video. I loved it, watched the Pewdiepie let's play, and got the game right after I got the demo. (It's a confusing demo, even for what the game is.)) So just go wild and say theories about this game! (But don't spoil it without saying you are intending to do so with a spoiler alarm.)

The Game: [http://store.steampowered.com/app/221910/](http://store.steampowered.com/app/221910/)

To be honest, I do not think the experience should be reduced by talking about it. This is one of those things you really need to experience, as it not only a story, but also a lesson on how you do things and play games.
Ok, it's just that I love this game and want to spread the word about it.

> 
> Ok, it's just that I love this game and want to spread the word about it.

Fair enough, the word deserves to be spread! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) It really is one of those titles that shows me gaming is becoming more mature as a form of expressing and investigating human nature. I am reluctant to call it a true art form yet, though it certainly is more than mere entertainment (and mere entertainment can admittedly and arguably be called art). More and more of these kinds of titles are cropping up and they seem more valuable than the n^th^ shooter with the same mechanics and similar story.
